oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Discussion - Johnny Cash's daughters in conversation - 2017-05-27
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Panel discussion with Cindy Cash, Kathy Cash, Tara Cash and Rosanne Cash from the CMA Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on May 27, 2017. Discussion moderated by Peter Cooper. In support of the photo exhibit I've Been Everywhere: Becoming Johnny Cash.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Cindy Cash; Kathy Cash; Rosanne Cash; Tara Cash;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Recorded muted audio signal / (04:23) Peter Cooper with introductory comments / (08:32) Opening comments from Tara about the photo scrapbook / (10:42) Rosanne talks about the photo of the boat leaving the New York harbor, what her father likely felt at the time, his love of travel / (13:17) Rosanne and Tara comment about their father loving being a radio operator / (14:00) Tara tells story about her father typing out Morse code alphabet for her on a typewriter / (14:40) Talk about the number of letters that their Mom and Dad wrote to each other and description of one of them / (16:29) Comments on a picture being shown to the audience / (16:45) Talk about the developing style that their father shows in the pictures taken / (17:28) Talk about his buddies being the ones taking the pictures of Johnny, the search for and establishing a relationship with the family of one of them / (20:03) Talk about the posing for photos and acknowledgment of the Memorial day weekend / (21:01) Comment on how these photographs reflect the shared American stories / (21:50) Acknowledgment of audience members Tommy Cash, Joann Cash and other family members / (22:36) Talk about a picture shown to the audience of Johnny rolling up his sleeves / (24:08) Talk about some of the pictures taken while on leave in Paris and his letters written back home / (25:30) Rosanne talks about her father making the scrapbooks himself and his pride in them and his trust in Vivian to save them along with other artifacts / (26:58) Talks about Johnny having a sense of himself / (27:49) Talk about Johnny's childhood background and Dyess Arkansas / (31:44) Talk about what Dyess Arkansas meant to their father / (33:03) Talk about how impressed Johnny was when he saw an appearance by the Louvin Brothers when he was a child / (33:45) Talk about a picture of Big Ben shown to the audience / (34:15) Talk about what having a radio meant to their father growing up and how scarce sugar was for him growing up / (35:28) Talk about growing up in the cocoon of the south and prejudices / (37:18) Talk about a photo of their Dad wearing plaid and his opinion of wearing black / (38:40) Talk about the photos of other people that Johnny took himself and his love of photography / (39:53) Talk about the photos shown to the audience / (43:44) Talk about Johnny maintaining his photography hobby through out his life / (44:33) Talk about a photo shown to the audience and how attractive their father was / (45:25) Talk about their father wanting something different in his life, his musical ambitions and him seeing a film on Folsom Prison / (46:46) Talk about his Air Force band and the foundation for the song I Walk The Line / (47:29) Talk about a mountain scene photo shown to the audience / (48:14) Talk about one of the photos shown to the audience of Johnny doing his monkey pose / (50:01) Talk about a fishing photo shown to the audience / (51:30) Talk about picture of Johnny snow skiing and him not being afraid to try anything / (52:25) Talk about a family photo shown to the audience / (53:32) Talk about the closeness of their family / (55:09) Talk about photographs sent to Johnny and the family correspondence and notes written on the back about the photos / (57:12) Talks about photo of a Christmas dinner sent to their father / (58:08) Talk about what the photo scrapbooks mean to them / (01:01:16) Tara talks about her book Recollections By J.R. Cash / (01:02:43) Kathy talks about her favorite photograph of her Dad after his visit to the Zoo which is shown to the audience / (01:05:18) Tara talks about her favorite photograph which is shown to the audience / (01:06:56) Cindy talks about her favorite photograph which is shown to the audience / (01:09:03) Rosanne talks about her favorite photograph which is shown to the audience / (01:11:20) Rosanne talks about her travels and how it changed her and inheriting her father's curiosity about travelling / (01:13:40) Closing comments from Peter / (01:14:37) Talk about what they think that they meant to their father / (01:20:04) Final comments from Peter / (01:21:23) Recording muted / (01:27:43) FILE END
